CatDescriptText: Lonnie Hicks, 2009 Rose Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 23, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "In the coming November elections, do you think voters should elect another Democratic Governor or change to a Republican?" Answer reads: "The voters should keep the same party. That way, there will be more job opportunities."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lonnie Hicks, wearing hat, light colored short sleeve shirt, and wristwatch, standing with arms folded on street with trolley tracks, in front of automobiles, and businesses, including building on far right with sign in window that reads "5th Ave. WASHING MACHINE SERVICE Ex. 1-4492"
